metadata.query: top news stories from Kolkata and Bengal today

articles.headline: Mobile apps to expand breast cancer outreach and care launched in Kolkata
articles.summary: The Institute of Breast Disease in Kolkata launched two mobile applications aimed at enhancing breast cancer awareness, early detection, and treatment adherence. The apps were inaugurated by Dr. Swapan Saren and attended by Principal Secretary Binod Kumar. This initiative marks a significant technological step in public health outreach.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Two new mobile apps launched to improve breast cancer awareness and care
• Focus on early detection and treatment adherence among women
• Initiative led by Institute of Breast Disease, Kolkata
• Launch event attended by Dr. Swapan Saren (Director of Health Services, West Bengal) and Principal Secretary (Education) Binod Kumar
• Aims to expand outreach to a broader and more diverse population
articles.context: Institute of Breast Disease – a specialized healthcare institution in Kolkata dedicated to breast cancer diagnosis, treatment, research, and awareness programs.

articles.headline: Nipah virus outbreak: 100 people quarantined in West Bengal
articles.summary: West Bengal health authorities have quarantined nearly 100 individuals following confirmation of five Nipah virus cases, including two critically ill nurses in Kolkata. The virus, with high fatality, spreads from animals to humans and through human contact. Supportive care remains the only treatment.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Five confirmed Nipah virus cases in West Bengal
• Nearly 100 individuals quarantined to contain spread
• Two nurses in Kolkata are critically ill and in coma
• Virus known for high fatality and zoonotic transmission
• No specific antiviral treatment; supportive care is primary approach
articles.context: Nipah virus – a zoonotic virus first identified in 1999 in Malaysia, known for high fatality rates and outbreaks in South and Southeast Asia; no specific treatment exists, making containment and early detection critical.

articles.headline: For 3rd time in Jan, North‑South Kolkata Metro ops hit due to tech snag
articles.summary: The North‑South Blue Line of Kolkata Metro experienced its third disruption in January due to technical issues, with the latest incident on January 22 causing a 42‑minute suspension. Services resumed by 8:17 AM after truncated operations.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Third major disruption in January 2026 on North‑South Blue Line
• Latest occurred January 22; first train stalled at Rabindra Sadan
• 42‑minute suspension between Maidan and Tollygunge
• Services truncated: Maidan to Dakshineswar and Mahanayak Uttam Kumar to Shahid Khudiram
• Normal operations resumed by 8:17 AM
articles.context: Kolkata Metro – India’s oldest metro system, operational since 1984, serving as a vital urban transit mode in the city; technical disruptions affect thousands of daily commuters.

articles.headline: Boy found dead in lift shaft
articles.summary: A tragic incident in Entally, Kolkata, where a 3‑year‑old boy named Pritam Rajbanshi was found dead in a water‑filled open elevator shaft at an under‑construction building. The child had injury marks, and his body was taken to NRS Hospital.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Victim: 3‑year‑old Pritam Rajbanshi
• Found dead in water‑filled open elevator shaft at under‑construction building in Entally
• Injury marks observed on the body
• Parents had reported him missing at Entally Police Station
• Body sent to NRS Hospital for examination

articles.headline: 16‑hour Setu shutdown for repairs on Sun
articles.summary: Vidyasagar Setu in Kolkata will be closed for 16 hours on Sunday (5 am to 9 pm) for essential repair work including cable and bearing replacement. Traffic diversions will be in place during the shutdown.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Vidyasagar Setu to be closed for 16 hours on Sunday (5 am to 9 pm)
• Repairs include replacement of stay and holding‑down cables and bearings
• Part of broader rehabilitation of the 33‑year‑old bridge
• Managed by Hooghly River Bridge Commissioners (HRBC)
• Kolkata Police to implement traffic diversions via alternate routes
articles.context: Vidyasagar Setu – also known as the Second Hooghly Bridge, a major cable‑stayed bridge connecting Kolkata and Howrah, opened in 1992 and vital for vehicular traffic across the Hooghly River.

articles.headline: R‑Day flyers told to reach airport early for checks
articles.summary: Ahead of Republic Day, Kolkata airport has enhanced security with two layers of screening, increasing average waiting time by 15‑20 minutes. Domestic passengers are advised to arrive three hours early, international four hours.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Security at Kolkata airport significantly increased for Republic Day
• Two layers of screening: at entrance and before boarding gates
• Additional personnel deployed at terminal entrances and screening areas
• Average waiting time increased by 15‑20 minutes
• Recommendation: domestic passengers arrive 3 hours early, international 4 hours
articles.context: Republic Day – celebrated annually on January 26 in India, marking the adoption of the Constitution in 1950; airports often enhance security during national holidays due to increased travel and heightened alertness.

articles.headline: Rudrajit Roy earns directorial honour at Third Eye Asian Film Festival
articles.summary: Kolkata filmmaker Rudrajit Roy received the Best Director (Special Jury Mention) award in the Indian Cinema Competition at the 22nd Third Eye Asian Film Festival. He is the only director from West Bengal to be honored at the event.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Rudrajit Roy won Best Director (Special Jury Mention) at 22nd Third Eye Asian Film Festival
• Award in Indian Cinema Competition category
• Only director from West Bengal to receive recognition at the festival
• Recognition for his latest film (unnamed)
• Highlights growing influence of regional Indian filmmakers internationally
articles.context: Third Eye Asian Film Festival – an annual event held in India celebrating cinematic excellence across Asia, showcasing films and talents from the region and fostering cultural exchange.

articles.headline: From SIR to pollution, current affairs enter Saraswati Puja pandals as themes
articles.summary: During Saraswati Puja in Kolkata, educational institutions used contemporary social and political themes to decorate their pandals, addressing issues like SIR process stress, pollution, women’s empowerment, and heritage.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Ballygunge Science College highlighted SIR process with symbolic elements (black hole, ropes, goalpost)
• Scottish Church Collegiate School focused on pollution control and plantation through artwork
• Jadavpur Vidyapith emphasized women’s empowerment and achievements
• Hindu School paid tribute to filmmaker Ritwik Ghatak on his centenary via Patachitra art
• Bhawanipur Mitra Institution showcased Kolkata’s evolution into a modern metropolis
articles.context: Saraswati Puja – a Hindu festival dedicated to Goddess Saraswati, celebrated widely in Bengal with elaborate pandals, cultural programs, and thematic decorations reflecting contemporary issues.

articles.headline: 2 Bengal migrant workers found dead in AP, Kerala
articles.summary: Two migrant workers from West Bengal were found dead in Andhra Pradesh and Kerala within 24 hours. One had received a ransom call before being killed; the other was found near a railway track. Families suspect foul play and demand investigations.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Manjur Alam Laskar (32, South 24 Parganas) found dead in Andhra Pradesh after ransom call demanding ₹25,000; family paid ₹6,000
• Family alleges he was targeted for being Bengali‑speaking Muslim and suspected as Bangladeshi
• Alamgir Alam (29, Malda) found dead near railway track in Chennai after last contact on January 14; family suspects murder
• Both incidents occurred within 24 hours in different states
• Families demand thorough investigations into suspicious deaths
articles.context: Migrant workers from West Bengal often travel to other states for employment; incidents of violence or suspicious deaths raise concerns about worker safety and interstate protections.

articles.headline: Santragachhi Jheel sewage plant & drain may be ready by Aug 31: State
articles.summary: The West Bengal government informed the NGT that the sewage treatment plant and garland drain project at Santragachhi Jheel in Howrah is 22% complete and expected to finish by August 31, 2026. The ₹28.8 crore project aims to reduce pollution in this migratory bird habitat.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Project 22% complete as of early January 2026
• Expected completion by August 31, 2026
• Budget: ₹28.8 crore; includes STP, pumping station, and garland drain
• Initiated following NGT directive due to pollution from municipal and railway sewage
• Additional efforts: waste management, public awareness, biodiversity projects, and handicraft use of water hyacinth
articles.context: Santragachhi Jheel – a lake in Howrah known for migratory birds; pollution from sewage has prompted environmental interventions and NGT oversight.

articles.headline: Gold Silver Price Today, 23 January, 2026: silver jumps ₹12,600, gold ₹2,800 in Kolkata
articles.summary: On January 23, 2026, silver prices surged by ₹12,600 and gold by ₹2,800 per 10 grams. In Kolkata, 22‑carat gold was ₹14,737/gm and 24‑carat ₹15,894/gm.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Silver price increased by ₹12,600 (unit unspecified) at market open
• Gold price rose by ₹2,800 per 10 grams
• Kolkata rates: 22‑carat ₹14,737/gm; 24‑carat ₹15,894/gm
• Other cities: Delhi 22‑carat ₹14,675/gm, 24‑carat ₹15,826/gm; Mumbai 22‑carat ₹14,623/gm, 24‑carat ₹15,773/gm
• Highest 24‑carat rate in Ranchi at ₹16,040/gm
articles.context: Gold and silver prices are closely watched in India for investment and cultural reasons; fluctuations reflect global trends and domestic demand.

articles.headline: From football to literature: Bonds that bind Argentina & West Bengal
articles.summary: The article explores cultural ties between Argentina and West Bengal, highlighting shared passions for football and literature. Argentine Ambassador Mariano A. Caucino notes admiration for Rabindranath Tagore and football fervor in both regions.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Cultural connection between Argentina and West Bengal despite 17,000 km distance
• Shared passions: football and literature
• Argentine Ambassador Mariano A. Caucino emphasizes these bonds
• Rabindranath Tagore’s works deeply respected in Argentina
• Highlights how sports and literature transcend borders
articles.context: Rabindranath Tagore – Bengali polymath and Nobel laureate poet whose works have global influence; football is a major cultural phenomenon in both Argentina and Bengal.

articles.headline: JEE Main 2026 Jan 23 Exam Postponed in West Bengal due to Saraswati Puja
articles.summary: The National Testing Agency postponed the JEE Main exam scheduled for January 23, 2026, in West Bengal due to clashes with Saraswati Puja. A revised date will be announced.
articles.detailed_summary:
• JEE Main exam on January 23 postponed in West Bengal
• Postponement due to Saraswati Puja celebrations
• Affected candidates will receive a revised date
• Announcement made via NTA’s ‘X’ handle
• Candidates advised to check official website for updates and new admit cards
articles.context: JEE Main – a national engineering entrance exam in India; Saraswati Puja is a major festival in West Bengal, often affecting academic schedules.

articles.headline: Kolkata Book Fair begins January 22 with Argentina as theme country
articles.summary: The Kolkata Book Fair started on January 22 and will run until February 3 at Salt Lake. Argentina is the theme country, the first non‑South Asian nation to be featured. Major publishers are participating, though Bangladesh’s presence is uncertain due to political sensitivities.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Book Fair runs from January 22 to February 3 at Boimela Prangan, Salt Lake
• Argentina is the theme country—the first non‑South Asian nation featured
• Major publishers include Penguin Random House, HarperCollins, Oxford University Press
• Bangladesh’s participation uncertain due to political sensitivities and government approvals
• Organized by Publishers and Booksellers Guild
articles.context: Kolkata Book Fair – one of Asia’s largest book fairs, held annually since 1976, attracting publishers, authors, and readers from across the world.
